content: This device may be of good use to hunters out in the wild.  The device could positively identify specific game animals that the hunter are trying to locate and notify them.  This can save time and effort in their search.  The device could discern between the different types of animals that cross the sensors path.

This technology could be used on doors so that it can unlock or open the door based on who is at the door. It could be trained to recognize a person and in turn it can unlock the door or open it based on whether that person is in it's database. This would be great when you are trying to get into your house and your hands are full. It would recognize that you belong in the house and it could open the door.

The could be used in the wilderness to track particular animals so that they can be counted and recorded. This could help researcher find out how many there could possible be in the wild and also it might be able to find new species. This could also help if tracking an endangered species to keep track of their numbers. It would be very helpful with it being weather resistant because it could potentially be in the wilderness for a long time.

Use the device as part of a home- or business-based alarm system where the motion of pets or humans could be programmed into the system to prevent false alarms. Other moving creatures, other than those programmed for "ignore" status would set off the alarm.

The device could be used in a school situation to identify people moving through the halls who are not already programmed into the system. In this way, it might identify unwanted or unallowed visitors to the school who may present a danger.
Hunters could use a series of the devices to "stake out" a hunting grounds and identify not only the presence of game, but the specific type of game in the area.

The device could be used to analyze changes in motion exhibited by an individual for, for example, medical diagnostics. Similarly, the analysis could be used to optimize a particular motion for sports (throwing, swinging a bat, golf swing, running motion, etc.)
Add in large buildings to monitor elevator use in order to find the fastest route to a place. For example screens on hospital walls showing real time data.
Use them to control small robotic systems in a manufacturing place.
Use them when hunting to find and locate small pray or bugs.
Use them for athletes to train and repeat exact movements of well timed/done plays.
Give them to blind people and add a talking function.
Add them to sewers and waterways to view leaks or problems before they happen.
Use the device for checking for termites.
Track ant infestations from outside to in your home in order to eliminate the problem.
Attach the devices to cars in place of a gps to automate cars.

it can be used for a child, if a child is having problems at school like if someone is bullying them this tech can identify the movement of the other person the bully in this situation and it can collect the info and when the parents or the teacher need proof it will be in the form of the objects. So they know exactly what was going on if the person being bullied was hit or verbally abused or any other things.

it can be used to put in public places like train stations, bus stations, airports. Parks and schools. It can easily recognize criminals and their patterns. If someone is wanted this technology will recognize them and alert the proper authorities.

It can be put on a baby right after they are born at the hospital. That way there would be no chance of another parent switching babies at birth or someone stealing your newborn. It will not cause any hard to the child. All it will do is be put on the arms or the legs in form of a strap or bracelet so that it wont and cant be easily cut or removed. It can be used as a tracking system.

can be used as a trap for speedster, not necessarily a trap but it will recognize people that speed in the same neighborhood all the time, not also in the same neighborhood but speeding in general. It will track their pattern and then it can also be modified to log their license plates so people like this can be apprehended and dealt with before they cause harm to the public with their aggressive behavior.

it can be used to follow endangered species, see where they are going and how many of them there are. If they are killing themselves or if there are poachers killing them so we know exactly why they are becoming extinct.
Can help firefighters locate animals in a fire.
Can be used to track intruders at schools.
Place it in a department store to try and identify if people are shoplifting based on how they are moving.
Track movement patterns of babies to see if they might have developmental delays or disabilities.
Use it to identify fouls or false starts in sporting events.
Use it to help actors better emulate the movement of the characters they're playing.
Help baseball pitchers refine their pitching technique.
Use the movement patterns as a password to enter a house.
Put it in a forest/habitat to try and detect species that are difficult to track and are in danger of extinction.
Use it to analyze and improve the running form of track and field athletes.
Use it to detect if people are lying based on how their face moves under questioning.
Use it to detect autism in young children based on their bodily movements.
Help people improve their weightlifting form.
Track the movement patterns of young athletes to identify ones who might be at higher risk of injury.
Track the movement patterns of people recovering from injury to more specifically tailor their rehabilitation protocol.
Identify movement patterns in feral animals acting strangely to see if they have rabies.
baby sleep/health monitor
police body camera
search and rescue operations
border patrol
can it see water moving underground? locate freshwater in drought areas
help soldiers locate enemy combatants
teddy bear nanny cam with alert functions
tech powered doggy door. Opens the door when it recognizes your pet
Can be used to assist a person with night vision capabilities when walking or jogging in the dark.
Can be used as a home monitoring alarm that warns you of intruders or suspicious moments when installed in home.
can be used in businesses to conduct security scans on customers when needed. Simply scan the customers body and confirm whether or not they are carrying weapons.

Another use of the technology could be by police departments when they are monitoring activity of criminals. The technology could record activity and see if there are patterns and identify possible suspects.
Environmental agencies could use it to track damage done by severe weather and look for people who may have been trapped and injured.
Retail mall security could use to track foot traffic and if there are any suspicious individuals who may want to do harm to another person.
Corporations could use it to monitor remote automated tasks that need to be done by a certain deadline.
Employee security and access into a building with swiping badges no longer necessary.
Airports can monitor flight patterns and if an airplane is where it should be.
Can be used to reduce crime rate
Radar sensor can be used by marine researchers
It will help the military in fighting war
Can be used as a spy gadget
Can be a great addition to the health sector
Can be used to study and measure heart rate, blood pressure
This technology could also be used to see where there could be trapped people either from a natural disaster or a house fire. I could help locate them by sensing movement.
It could be used in space on advanced telescopes to spot incoming large objects that could be potential threats to the planet.

It could be used to follow vehicle and pedestrian paths in a city to help facility better designed structures and roads. The movement data could be used to help identify ways of decreasing traffic choke points or to monitor traffic flow through an intersection.
It can be used by police in conjunction with police scanners to identify the type or size of the vehicle or object. This could aid in low light or inclement weather conditions.
It could be used to trace activity beneath clothes. Could be used at airports to identify what people may be carrying on their person underneath their clothing.

It could be used to predict the direction of an object. If doing a scan of an animal that needs to be captured it may be able to compare it to the database and predict it's pattern thus making capture easier.
Use in sports like running to identify areas for improvement in runners' strides, and improve on athletic performance
Use in wildlife areas to identify, count, and track different animals
Use to track movement of workers in job settings in order to identify areas for increased efficiency of movement resulting in higher productivity
Use in low visibility work environments (fog, smoke, firefighting), to detect living humans or animals.
Use in military settings to detect enemy soldiers in low visibility settings
Use to track human or animal movements in locations with severe weather conditions
Much like sonar and radar, we can use this technology to determine movements in warzones and what kind of movements are happening. This will help track the enemy and bolster defense reactions.

We can use this motion technology in the medical field to track movements of patients going through physical therapy in order to make sure their movements are correct and can serve as a check for the instructor to use.
We can use the motion of trees and other plants to determine wind patterns and get a more accurate and precise measure when cross checked between weather stations

We can use these tracking in the field of 3D games that use physics engines as well as general physics simulations on a computer to further understand and apply realistic experiments without having to do so in the real world.
It can be used in a situation of burglary. Throw a smoke grenade down automatically and see where the thieves run to. It will be useful in home and commercial security.
This would be useful for locating and tracking animals on land whom are endangered.
This could track migration patterns in animals and birds or other wildlife that do not live in the ocean.
This would be useful in identifying and finding individuals if they are lost in a public space, like a mall or theme park.
This could be used as surveillance on humans or criminals, like with law enforcement.
This could be used to track individuals when they are traveling by bicycle (for bike races) or other accessible vehicle that doesn't have impenetrable metal.
This could be used to track horses and their jockeys during horse racing.
This could also be used to locate and follow individuals who are participating in events like triathlons, marathons, and other outdoor spots.
This could also be used to locate and follow individuals who are participating in events like triathlons, marathons, and other outdoor sports. (Last submission had a typo.)
This could identify and locate children during extracurricular activities or field trips.
This could be used to track the movement of dancers when they are doing choreography.
guide robots
help vehicles avoid collisions
map out and create virtual reality environments based on real locations
Helps to study weather patterns for future prediction improvements.
Can identify and conduct inventory automatically.

This technology could help me to have a better experience at the beach. It could warn me about bad weather coming up. It could also direct me to a less crowded area.  It could also warn me about when I have had too much sun exposure.

This technology could help me with my crochet projects, but letting me know how much work I have done, how long I have worked on it, and if I have enough yarn left to complete the project, and if not, how much more I will need.
This could help me when I am jogging to warn me about bad weather and heavy traffic. It could also plan my best route.

This technology might be useful in un-manned rockets to explore asteroids, stars and planets. Because of the unknown and known climates of these bodies, this would enable us to compare and contrast movements of objects on Earth to those of which they detect in outer space, especially as the equipment works in challenging atmospheres.

This technology might have a useful application is crowd control, be it a concert or a protest. Analyzing what movements people make when they are in peril or moments of joy etc. This kind of analysis may be useful when designing venues, it terms of exits etc, in a law enforcement application it can be used to predict crowd behavior.
an alarm system that detects movement, records it, sets off an alarm.
exploring dark places like caves
as a military or law enforcement tool to use in situation where they are assessing whether people or anything else may be in a building or room they want to enter.
As a sensor on rovers or other vehicles we send into space.
To use in wildlife research, where movement triggers a camera.
An Orwellian surveillance system as in The Dark Knight
This technology can be used to track endangered species in the wild to help keep count of them.
It can track migration patterns of animals.
Can detect a potential robbery if used in stores to record previous motions that resulted in armed robbery. Will alert if actions are similar of customers in the store.
The technology can be used my hunters to see if there is any movement similar to the animals they are hunting.
It can be used to compare aircraft activity.
It can be used to detect movement of automobiles and their speed along with the probability of an accident based on history.
It can be used for detecting movement in front of doors and automatically opening them.
It can be used for detecting movements through smoke in a military environment.
It could aid first responders or law enforcement in locating lost or injured people outdoors.
It could assist a fisherman with determining how many and what type of fish are in an a particular area of a body of water.
It could help to identify and rescue people trapped in severe weather conditions.
It could help a hunter determine what type of animals are in the area at night.
It could be used for home security by monitoring your home and alerting to unknown people and motions.
This technology could be used to extrapolate walking data from pedestrians moving about and use the data to construct optimal street layouts for efficient walking and crosswalks.

We could position these devices in strategic areas around bee colonies and track individual bee flight paths and behavior to better understand a pivotal part in our planets ability to germinate crops.

An obvious application of such technology would be to implement it into all forms of autonomous vehicles, being able to track, process and predict obstructions in the line of sight even through smoke and fog would be invaluable and life saving.

Another application for this technology would be in face masks for all types of situations, like for example firefighters being able to scan a smoke filled room and not only find survivors in need of rescue but using the AI predict the safest route to them and out of the building. This could also be used in hostage rescue situations or any search and rescue.

The best use of this technology I can personally think of is combining it with a short burst laser technology to track and shoot down mosquito all over the world, setting them up around potential breeding areas for them, with the very cheap cost and effectiveness of lasers to destroy them and this technology to track and target them, we could eliminate massive sources of death and disease in the world.
If in every area of the city, it would be virtually impossible for criminals to escape the police through the tracking offered by these devices.
Missile defense system in the military.
Allow robots to play sports.
Mix with automatic cars and flying cars to make flying cars that are not ridiculously dangerous.
Integrate with automatic cars to make them safer and more precise.
Depending on how good it is compared to previous generations it could make for a good motion controller for a video game
It could be used to track sports games so better live updates could be sent to websites
